snippet: A second round of elections is looking far likelier, as is the possibility, previously far-fetched, of Greece giving up the euro.
abstract: Greece's political leaders fail again to form a government after Alexis Tsipras, the leader of the radical left Syriza party, is unable to gather support for a leftist coalition; opportunity passes to the Socialist party, but that effort is also expected to fail, throwing the country into a second round of elections that Greece's foreign lenders fear will lead to still more instability.

byline.original: By RACHEL DONADIO and NIKI KITSANTONIS
byline.contributor: Paul Geitner contributed reporting from Brussels, and Dimitris Bounias from Athens.

lead_paragraph: A second round of elections is looking far likelier, as is the possibility, previously far-fetched, of Greece giving up the euro.

headline.seo: In Greece, Leaders Again Fail to Form a Government
headline.main: Continuing Leadership Deadlock in Greece as Its Lenders Watch and Wait
headline.print_headline: Continuing Leadership Deadlock in Greece as Its Lenders Watch and Wait
